intro: Matricaria intermedia, commonly known as chamomile, is a herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its daisy-like flowers, which consist of a central yellow disk surrounded by white or pale yellow ray florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in well-drained soil and full sun. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, often used in teas and herbal remedies. Matricaria intermedia is also valued for its calming properties and is commonly used in aromatherapy and traditional medicine.
